title: Simple and clean
comment: Exactly what I was looking for: a simple and clean app to play streaming music/radio channels of my own choice.   I've encountered some bugs, mostly with the display of metadata (which is marked experimental) but I'm not complaining, and I'm sure these will improve with time. Best: No ads!  Yay!  Once kinks are worked out, I would pay for this app.

title: best
comment: no ads, simple, useful

title: Titles for streams
comment: Needs the ability to replace the address with a name of the stream. Currently allows you to do this, but fails to display when you go to the screen with your streams. Unless you type it in when you first enter the stream, you will see the address instead of the name. Otherwise, great!
Great app

title: best streaming app (even including an alarm clock)

title: Works great.

title: JUST what I was looking for!
comment: I set up my own streaming service (my cable company doesn't "support" streaming from my dvr unless I pay for it) then I made a simple html interface to poll my dvr AND my computer drive.  This is the ONLY player that lets me punch in my own url(with required port setting) AND it enumerates my embedded web links.  Well done guys, I have hundreds of recordings and movies, this feature saves me a lot of time.

title: The best mms Android steamer out there, BUT. ..
comment: Improvements could be made regarding buffering while streaming over a mobile data connection.  Also, having the ability to retrieve text data which is broadcast with the stream would be helpful. Finally, there shoulddefinitely be a stop icon included on the played itself. Unlike other streaming players, this one doesn't stop data when pause is enabled. Fix these guys and you'll get a perfect five!

title: Good for WiFi,  very bad for mobile devices with a data plan
comment: When  I use this app on WiFi only devices it works great.  The problem I have with this app is the fact it wiped out all of my mobile data allotment by secretly playing in the background. I thought I had properly closed the app by swiping it away in recent apps, and now I need to pay for more data.

I listen to one stream and one stream only. All the freaking time. I got this app hoping to use a Bluetooth car adapter to control the stream without removing my phone from my pocket when I get in my car. Unfortunately I haven't been able to get that to work. I can make it work by navigating through my phone. Also it turns the Bluetooth volume up to max for some reason and will override me turning the volume down when I'm in the app.

title: Great for all kinds of audio streams including BBC's new HLS output
comment: ServeStream is an excellent audio streaming client.  I use it for BBC's new HLS encapsulated AAC streams and it plays them fine and I get fewer interruptions than with the BBC's own iPlayer Radio apps.  It also works great for playing audio files stored on network shares accessible in a file manager like Explorer/Root Explorer or GhostCommander.

I absolutely love it to bits!

title: Works perfectly for m3u mp3 streaming playlist
comment: I tried just about every app out there and eventually found this one.  It's the only that 'just works' - no popup ads, takes a URL as its data or can be the default handler for m3u files.  EDIT: Looks like it's changed - it doesn't auto-play the URL when you use it as a m3u handler, instead it opens a new playlist dialog.  I can't use it automatically like this.  However it still works to pass the URL as the data field when launching the app...

title: Incredible
comment: I have an m3u playlist on my home machine that contains over 2000 URLs, one per line, representing my mp3 collection.  Very few applications, on windows, linux, or MAC can handle processing this file properly.  ServeStream does this FLAWLESSLY and fast, just like the venerable mplayer.  Well done developer.  You have my eternal gratitude.  Now I can stream MY mp3 collection from ANYWHERE in the world.

Stephen, if you can't select ServeStream using the "open with..." dialog simply long click on the URL and use the "share with" option and select ServeStream as the app.

title: Not really reliable enough
comment: Sometimes won't connect to a URL, sometimes seems to connect but then won't play anything. Music playback is mostly good once it gets going, but quite often drops out for about 5 seconds.  After a morning of this, I'll get frustrated and switch to a desktop streaming app on the same WiFi network, and have no trouble at all.  My Android WiFi stays on at all times, so it's not that, and I've used other streaming apps that don't suffer the same foibles.  It's OK, but it needs some work.

title: Uninterrupted listening while using other apps
comment: ServeStream essentially turned my Xoom tablet into an internet clock radio when I travel.  No  hiccups with jellybean. No interruptions when I check email or use my internet browser.  The dark screen interface is a plus.

title: Does not open urls
comment: Keeps asking for valid url even when given one.

title: Lightweight, works great.
comment: Great playback robustness with no buffer problems. App is lightweight, starts fast, has a very unobtrusive interface and can work for extended periods of time without issues (I was listening to a stream riding my motorcycle for 4 hours and encountered only half a dozen of pauses).   The fact that there's no station database bundled with the app is a plus for me since I'm only listening to a few specific streams and those databases usually take up memory and slow down startup.  Knocked a star off for the lack of international character support from Shoutcast metadata, but will amend the review  (or submit a new one) if this is fixed following a bug report.  Thanks for the great app William!

title: buggy
comment: once connected would not display playback screen, and crashes soon after.

title: Great
comment: Works great for me.

title: Great!
comment: Best app ever! I <3 ServeStream!

title: Better alternatives exist...
comment: ...such as DeaDBeeF, which is far superior to any custom URL streaming app at this time, simply because it works.  For some reason, William is emphasizing that it is open source.  But it doesn't always work William, and neither dakun nor me mentioned open source, so it's you who doesn't know what you're talking about.  And DeaDBeeF has a 10-band EQ which, despite what William says, is indeed essential if you are listening through a small device speaker and don't want bass distortion at high volume.  And it works with Icecast Ogg Vorbis streams, including the display of metadata. ServeStream doesn't, and so I came here to let others know, which is the purpose of a review, William.  I neither need to have built my own app, nor spent time trying to fix this one, when better alternatives exist (the title of my review).

NEITHER work in ICS on my Bionic (ICS .229 leak), and they both took about 90 seconds between pressing play and hearing sound on 905. title: Surprised
comment: I had searched over a couple of apps to get my streaming content to play on my phone.  While several programs might work on some phones, they were not on mine.  When I first got ServeStream it failed to play the streams I tried.  I almost uninstalled to resume my search.  I scanned the overview once to see if there might be any help before I did and noticed I was encouraged to email the developer.  I figured, "What could I lose..."  While I can't say if it's normal, I had a response and fix to my issue in under 12 hours of my email going out.  If any of you try this app and have trouble running a stream, try emailing before uninstalling, you might just be surprised.

title: Works perfectly for me.
comment: Very simple way to stream web radio. It uses much less CPU than other web radio programs and it lets me specify exactly what URL to use. I've been looking for this for months. Would be perfect if it showed the title of what it's streaming (name of song, ...).
It's so easy to use and works seamlessly. It's playing in the background as i enter this comment!
I love this application. It works flawlessly with my HTC EVO phone.
Frequently FCs (I've been reporting), needs to display Artist/Song for Shoutcast streams, ui needs usability improvements. DROID1/2.2.1 Thx for app!
This hella sucked. Dont work with my mac

title: Excellent
comment: I needed a way to stream podcasts downloaded by miro through vlc to my android phone. ServeStream works perfectly well when streaming MP3s. There isn't another viable application that can play custom streaming media.
Please add support for password protected streams. No android shoutcast clients with ogg support have this feature.
I have searched for DAYS for a simple url streaming player. This is it!! Thank you so much this is the only tool in existence that meets my needs.
Plays the audio link stream for about 15 seconds then cuts out repeatedly. It does have potential tho, I wish they'd fix it.
Awesome! Will donate. Now i can listen to Frisky Radio and somaFM! If you have Galaxy S phone, get Galaxy Tuner app too, has eq and boost your audio.
Keeps freezing and restarts my phone. Motorola Atrix
Mobile frisky radio!!!
Love it

title: note bad
comment: the last update seemed to fix a few things i didnt like but it is a decent player,, would like to show the song playing and station name tho you put that on and ill give it 5 stars
Mytouch 4g - best pls I've used. Streaming one hour straight. Heaven!
Wow finally an app that can play my favorite radio station's ogg stream! I tried so many different apps before finding this one.
D.O.A. on Mytouch 4G. Won't stream squat.
Works about 75% of the time. The UI sucks. I wish there were a viable alternative.
It simply works for pls + ogg. Nice.
It works, for the most part. My wish list: pause during a phone call, a "stop" button, and a skip-to-live feature.
W
Best app ever , if this had 10 stars i would give it a 12 star :)
Very nice. Please add flac and mp2 support.
Cant get it to work
Developer is very responsive to bug reports.
Great app streams Radioio perfect ! HTC EVO
A little difficult to navigate but a very useful app to play online streams.
Works great!
Awesome. I was able to stream music from my PC with very little configuration. Once setup, it works like a champ.
Cant stream pls
does what it set out to do, but gives no visual feedback of what is playing, or any stats at all. that is a flaw imho. 3 stars
So i'm unable to open .pls files which is what Idownloaded the app for soo wats up with that
Worked fine, but the last update broke it :(
Can you show me websites to watch movies
nice! I can listen my fav radio's archive (.m3u). thanks!
Simple, non-bloated and does exactly what it promises.
This app has potential but has bugs. it choked on a direct server address link and I had to shut down the phone to stop playback. Please. Keep develop
All I needed,perfect,thank you,ksfooo
It won't even play my home mp3 http stream
To my knowledge, this is the only media app that can stream live ogg vorbis. Great!
